intro: Chamaesyce libassii, commonly known as the narrow-leaf sandmat, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and small, inconspicuous yellow flowers. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in sandy or rocky soils. Chamaesyce libassii is typically found in open habitats such as grasslands and along coastal dunes.
